v1: There is music in my heart, a song for Him I love;
There's a hymn upon my lips, of tender grace.
All my love's poured out on Him, loving until I am restored;
Loving Jesus till my heart is soothed and new.
v2: Though I'm weak and often fail, my love for Him is strong;
Yet I often seek elsewhere for happiness.
Still His love it draws me close, though I am fragile and so cold;
He will ever, always, hold me in His love.
v3: Though I think I am so strong, yet truly I am weak;
When temptations come my way, I am undone;
Still my Lord, He loves me so, even as I am full of shame;
Oh, He loves me, and He loves eternally.
v4: Disappointed oft am I, yet still I trust Him more;
When my spirit is so weak, I groan and sigh;
Then my Love refreshes me, and He whispers softly saying:
"I love you and I will never let you go."
v5: There is music in my heart, a song for Him I love;
There's a hymn upon my lips, of tender grace;
I will testify of Him, loving Him till I am restored,
Loving Jesus till my heart is soothed and new.
